Through the official Navee Amazon storefront, you can now find the brand’s newest XT5 Pro Electric Scooter at $1,099.99 shipped, after clipping the on-page $200 off coupon, beating out its direct website pricing by $200. The latest of Navee’s electric commuting solutions, this model fetches $1,500 at full price directly from the brand, but has been starting off at $1,600 here at Amazon, with first discounts in December having taken the costs down to $1,400, then to $1,300. Now, you can jump aboard with even more savings as another $200 is cut from the tag (for $400 total savings off the going rate), landing it down at a new all-time low price.

items.title: Lectric cuts e-bike accessories as low as $67: Pet trailer, coolers, buddy seat, more
items.summary:
As part of Lectric’s Valentine’s Day e-bike sale, the popular e-mobility brand is also offering up to 15% discounts on select add-on accessories for your ride, like the Pet Trailer for $169 shipped, bringing it down from its full $199 price tag. We’ve previously seen this trailer go as low as $152 back during the brand’s Christmas stocking stuffer sale, with prices otherwise having been seen keeping above $179 when offered discounts, making this the second-best deal you can score it with. This handy little trailer is a great addition if you love taking your furry friends along with you, allowing you to safely shepherd them to parks, appointments, and beyond. It features durable waterproof mesh fabric walls with a zippable opening at the top, as well as an easy-access zipper opening at the front window (plus a plastic cover there). One thing to note if you want to connect it to the Lectric XP Trikes, specifically, is that you’ll also need this hitch and tow bar that is sold separately. Head below to see the full lineup of Valentine’s Day accessory deals, and be sure to also shop the Lectric Valentine’s Day e-bike deals here.

While you may spy it carrying a $599 MSRP directly from the brand, and occasionally reaching that high price at Amazon, you’re more likely to find it floating down around $429 on average. While we have seen it go as low as $377 during Black Friday, as well as a one-time $349 low for a single day in early November, you’re still looking at a solid extra $30 cut from its usual going rate ($200 off the MSRP) that lands it at the third-best price we have tracked. Head below to shop the other flash offers before they end tomorrow night, January 30. You can also shop the full EcoFlow January Monthly Madness Sale lineup in our original coverage here.
